column4: open   /etc/apt/sources.list.d/medibuntu.list file it looks like you have a stray " character.   mine says   deb http://packages.medibuntu.org/ hardy free non-free and under that #deb-src http://packages.medibuntu.org/ hardy free non-free
how do i open that?  i'm a new to linux...
in terminal   gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list.d/medibuntu.list
i have the list, now what?
the error message mentioned it didnt recognize '  are there any stray  ' characters?
no mention of stray or unrecognized characters, says it's ok
is update manager working now?
will try, hold on...
got lost there for sec...  update manager is not working
it looks like my connection is still referring to the medibuntu source list, should it be referring to some other general repository list?
any error messages?
how do i send messages to you on the pastebin?
ok  open system>admin>software sources then Third party software tab and uncheck mediubuntu and try again.  this will tell you if thats the problem
yeah... mediubuntu is not even in that list, i only show archive.canonical and archive.canonical (source code)
ok lets rename that file and try again in terminal type   sudo mv etc/apt/sources.list.d/medibuntu.list etc/apt/sources.list.d/medibuntu.list.old   and try update again   ok?
just saw your last message, will try
ok lets rename that file and try again in terminal type   sudo mv etc/apt/sources.list.d/medibuntu.list etc/apt/sources.list.d/medibuntu.list.old   and try update again   ok?
no such file or directory
can i pm?
ok to private message?
yeah that's coo
